inclusion.criterion: Continuous or intermittent gradually progressive back pain for more than 3 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: not significantly improving on medical treatment and/or physical modalities.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Local / paraspinal pain or tenderness with or without radiation to buttock , groin or thigh.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Increase of pain on extension , rotation or lateral bending .
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: MRI detected synovitis of the facet joint as defined and graded by Czervionke and Fenton, 2008.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Acute low back trauma, fractures, malignancies and inflammatory diseases.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Pain score of < 4 at rest on visual analog scale.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has had positive history of sickle cell crises since childhood. He also had the same symptoms in past two weeks treated with oxycodone which was not beneficial to his pain.
